entry.title: Control Flow Unflattening
entry.content:
Target

Recently I have analyzed a RASP solution called Approov. Although there are some novel detection techniques, overall itâ€™s not that interesting. Instead, I will focus on the obfuscation part of the native library, control flow flattening. You can find a host app with a little googling :)

CFF

Control flow flattening (CFF) in a nutshell is a technique to obfuscate code flow by rearranging code blocks (+create new basic blocks) into switch cases. Visualizing it is more straightforward:

If you think about the dynamic analysis perspective, the execution flow is the same as in the first case. The dispatcher (gray block) should execute blocks in the order of normal execution. Since you need to follow the state variable after each â€œcaseâ€ execution, static analysis is harder for a reverse engineer and sometimes state variable is also obfuscated.

After seeing the cffâ€™ed binary I looked up earlier research about cff. I tried to work with stadeo, then found eShard d810. Stadeo uses miasm to lift binary and then analyze the cff whereas d810 uses HexRays microcode (intermediate representation of IDA). D810 can backward track variables, emulate microcode, and have very easy-to-extend config/rule sets for opaque predicates, etc. So I sticked to d810. Make sure to read their blogs about d810[1][2]

Microcode

D-810 hooks the decompilation process of IDA and makes changes. Micro instructions(minsnt_t), micro-operations (mop_t), blocks (mblocks_t) in microcode. Before giving execution back to IDA final mba needs to be verified.

Oh, boi.. Before realizing all internal errors of (INTERR) microcode was documented in hexrays_sdk/verifier/verify.cpp I tried to find the meaning of all INTERRâ€™s by dumping microcode. I used d810â€™s dump_microcode_for_debug function to dump microcode which helped a lot for debugging. To debug D810 (or any IDA Pro plugin) I followed this blog post

Unflatten

To unflatten, we need to find state variables in dispatcher fathers. The Dispatcher father is a block that goes into the dispatcher directly. If we know the state variable in dispatcher father, we can calculate the next dispatched block from dispatcher and replace the dispatcher fatherâ€™s next location with found block.

Letâ€™s give a example from the sample. Each switch case body and initial state variable assignments are a dispatcher father.

Switch case starts with initial state variable 1010106. Knowing if state is 1010106 (X), dispatcher(Y) will go into code block(Z): v1 = (qword_470e8 == 0) + 1010107, We can directly go into block(Z) from assignment of 1010106(X). Meaning instead of X->Y->Z we will have X->Z

In d810 there is a rule for cff with a switch table called default_unflattening_switch_case.json. Unfortunately, it does not work for this case. But why? Because of the v1 = (qword_470e8 == 0) + 1010107. It can generate two different variables from single block.

Actually, they tried to solve this problem. If a block can have more than one state variable value (think about two if cases with different state assignments), they â€œduplicate any block which appears in (at least) 2 paths with (at least) 2 different predecessors.â€ But there is no predecessor in this case. So how I solved it ? By creating jz condition with two new blocks.

Letâ€™s look at the microcode representation of these blocks to understand easier. To show microcode I used a plugin called lucid

  • Take comparison part of block 5
  • make it jz condition with comparison
  • Create two new blocks with calculated state variable
  • fix in/out bounds of blocks

After finding dispatcher fathers, I used the mop tracker history feature of d810 to find all father histories and fixed instructions that can create two state variables before executing generic unflattening of d810.

After the changes, all dispatcher fathers have constant state variables. Then we can use d810â€™s cff solver part and continue.

Bad While Loops

After solving jump tables I saw bad while loops. Not that important but we can simplify these too.

Microcode represantation is as following

Block 14 is a dispatcher and exit blocks (like jtbl) are 16, 19, 21 (outbounds of jump conditions). Dispatcher fathers can be calculated from inbounds of block 14: 13 and 18. I created new flattening optimizer class in d810 and used it to clear bad while loops.

Conclusion

Hexrays Microcode is a powerful beast and playing with it was fun. And the feeling of seeing 2k line of code unflattened is ğŸ‘Œ. If you have any questions you can ping me at @0xabc0

References

CFF Example image taken from jscrambler.com
Rolf Rolles blog post
Sophos Attacking Emotetâ€™s Control Flow Flattening
eShard d810 cff post
eShard d810 deobf post
TAU Defeating Compiler-Level Obfuscations
Quarkslab Deobfuscation: recovering an OLLVM-protected program
HexRaysDeob
IDA Plugin: lucid
IDA Plugin: d810
Debugging IDA Pro plugins

entry.title: Mobile Malware Analysis : Overlay and How to Counter It (Partly)
entry.content:
Defeating Overlay

In my last anubis post I touched on overlay and how malware use process scanning to get top process. If somehow we can bypass those techniques, in a way overlay can be defeated. In this
post I will try to explain my way of finding a protection for some android versions.

TLDR;

You can use

to change your applicationâ€™s name to protect users that have android 5.1 and 6.0

What is process scanning and why malware use it?

Process scanning is a way for getting list of running processes. Most of the android malware use process scanning to get top activity currenlty running. Then they use this information for deploying overlay attacks. Knowing which processes is currenly top active, helps to select which phishing overlay page malware will use and make attack more believable. Android was aware of this attack vector and take some steps to disable these functions. Here is a blogpost cover overall situtation.

Generally android is secure environment for processes. Each application have different userid and none of application/process have rights to read/write of other processes data. But up until API 23, there was always a way to read process list without any permission. After API 23, applications need to get PACKAGE_USAGE_STATS (system permission) or Accessibility permissions to read process list.

Problem

Lets say com.x.bank is targeted application by malware. Malware infected the device and overlays com.x.bank. Mechanism of overlaying itself can be divided in two elements. First one is triggering when com.x.bank started (achieved via process scanning) and second one is how an app can overlay itself on top of another app. Second element is functionality of android applications. Any app can open itself with the help of services/receivers/intents. We canâ€™t interfere that functionality. What about first element of overlay mechanism ? Is there a way for an application to defend itself by not being in process list or giving randomized name to process list ? This was in my head for a long time.

Thoughts

Randomize package name
Change process name
Hide from usage stats service ? :)

Android Version vs Technique

Each android version invervals malware use different techniques to list process/package names.

APITechnique
<= 19runningTask.get(0).topActivity
20,21getRunningAppProcesses().get(0).processName
22 23/proc/pid/cmdline, /proc/pid/stat

23 | UsageStats (anubis) or Accessibility (hydra)

According to Android usage distrubition chart of android versions as follows :

VersionCodenameAPIUsage Percent
4.4Kitkat19%7.6
5.0Lollipop21%3.5
5.122%14.4
6.0Marshmallow23%21.3
7.0Nougat24%18.1
7.125%10.1
8.0Oreo26%14.0
8.127%7.5

Processes in Android

If I can change process name of the application, since malware checks static package names, I can avoid being detected.

Sadly I can only do something for /proc/pid listing techniques. (which is %35.7 of android users tho) To get information about process there are several places. You can try yourself also.

  • /proc/pid/cmdline
  • /proc/pid/stat
  • /proc/pid/status

To change process name I came across to prctl system call. Using PR_SET_NAME and New name as argument one can change current processâ€™ name. Maybe I could call prctl from native side of application and change process name. But before writing code I tried it with frida. I hooked prctl and checked if its called with PR_SET_NAME (15). Then I replaced called string with another string.

And voila

Ps commands shows new process name but malware doesnâ€™t get changed name. Because proc/pid/cmdline didnâ€™t change. Also why prctl even called ? Since I didnt know much about how android processes get their names I searched up again. How can process change its cmdline or stat value ? Stackoverflow. But does Android application have argc or argv ? So I searched aosp project and come across to this :) See the comment

In android there is a process called Zygote. Zygote is the ancestor of all processes like init0. Every process is fork of zygote.
After being forked from zygote, applicationâ€™s process name changes within app_main.cpp. Knowing that I looked up which function I could used and saw setArgv0 which sound right. Then I tried with application. Opened up android studio.

But android studio didnâ€™t resolve setArgv0. If I go to declartion of Process class I can see setArgv0 there.

So whats happenning ?
See @hide tag. That tag means its hidden from developer because they are internally used and can be changed in future APIs. Also these methods can be classified in four list after Android 9. But we are trying to protect users that use Android 6. So there is no problem.

You canâ€™t directly call these hidden methods but you can use reflection (big thanks to @ibrahimsn98!)

With this, process name is changed everywhere cmdline,stat,status. YAY!

I created 2 apk to test this. One apk is getting processes. I used this project which is used in Anubis. And other app is changing its process name with setArgv0.

The reason why app is not in process list is scanner app tries to access /data/app/package-name folder. Since we changed the name, it tries to access /data/app/0xabc0 which is not there. So it doesnâ€™t display it.

Thoughts

For other methods I couldnâ€™t find anything. Android can give rights/permissions to applications for not being in stats menu to avoid being detected by USAGE_STATS or by Accessibility maybe . Targeted apps can be saved from overlaying attacks with these rights.

Conclusion

With little code you can change your applicationâ€™s process name in certain API versions. It can be used to protect users from malware :)

References

https://www.geeksonsecurity.com/android-overlay-malware/2016/07/27/android-overlay-malware-analysis/

https://www.symantec.com/connect/blogs/android-malware-finds-new-ways-derive-current-running-tasks

https://www.nowsecure.com/blog/2017/05/25/android-overlay-malware-system-alert-window-permission/

Bu fonksiyonda Ã¶nce 4byteâ€™Ä±n md5ini alÄ±yor. Bu digest deÄŸerini aes keyi olarak kullanÄ±yor ve input olarak verilen dosyayÄ± decrypt ediyor. dp1â€™i Ã§aÄŸÄ±rÄ±ken classâ€™Ä±n baÅŸÄ±nda tanÄ±mlanmÄ±ÅŸ
public static String p1EncFn = "ckxalskuaewlkszdva"; deÄŸeri kullanÄ±lÄ±yor. Apkâ€™Ä±mÄ±zÄ±n iÃ§erisindeki asset klasorune bakarsak bu dosyayÄ± gÃ¶rebiliyoruz. Peki bu dosyayÄ± decrypt edip ne yapÄ±yor ?

Decrypt edilen dosya DexClassLoader APIsi ile contexte yÃ¼kleniyor. Bu olayÄ± android malwarelerinde Ã§ok gÃ¶rÃ¼yoruz. Tersine mÃ¼hendisliÄŸi zorlaÅŸtÄ±rmak iÃ§in â€œpackingâ€ yÃ¶ntemini sÄ±klÄ±kla kullanÄ±yorlar.

ooo.p1.P1 classâ€™Ä± invoke edilip o class iÃ§erisinden bir fonksiyon Ã§aÄŸÄ±rÄ±lÄ±yor. Bu fonksiyon boolean bir deÄŸer dÃ¶ndÃ¼rÃ¼yor ( O fonksiyonda baska fonksiyonlar cagiriyor tabi ). Ve flagin doÄŸruluÄŸu kontrol edilmiÅŸ oluyor .

  • md5

Peki biz bu 4byteâ€™Ä± nasÄ±l bulabiliriz ?

Biliyoruzki decrypt edilen dosyanÄ±n bir jar dosyasÄ± olmasÄ± lazÄ±m. Neden ? Ã‡Ã¼nkÃ¼ kullanÄ±lan DexClassLoader fonksiyonu dosya formatÄ± olarak jar kabul ediyor. Jar dosyalarÄ± da bir nevi zip ve zip dosyalarÄ±nÄ±n Magic Byteâ€™Ä±nÄ± yani dosya tipini anladÄ±ÄŸÄ±mÄ±z header kÄ±smÄ±nÄ± biliyoruz. \x50\x4b\x03\x04 dosya headerÄ± olarak bu bytelarÄ± arayacaÄŸÄ±z.

Åimdi brute iÃ§in ÅŸu ÅŸekilde bir python scripti yazalÄ±m:

GirdiÄŸimiz stringler sonuÃ§ta ASCII yani 7bitlik aralÄ±kta olduÄŸu iÃ§in XOR sonucu elde edilecek byte aralÄ±ÄŸÄ±da bu aralÄ±ÄŸa sahip olmak zorunda.

Burda dikkatinizi DATA = open('ckxalskuaewlkszdva', 'rb').read(32) satÄ±rÄ±na vermenizi rica ediyorum. Neden 32 byte okuyorum burada ?

aes

AES CBC encryption ÅŸemasÄ±nda sizin dosyanÄ±z ne kadar bÃ¼yÃ¼se de ilk bloÄŸun son halini ilgilendiren bir olay gerÃ§ekleÅŸmiyor. Yani biz sadece ilk blok iÃ§in deneme yaparak keyi bulabiliriz. Bu Ã§ok bÃ¼yÃ¼k Ã¶lÃ§Ã¼de iÅŸimizi kolaylaÅŸtÄ±rÄ±yor. 1.6 MB dosyanÄ±n boyutunu 32byteâ€™a dÃ¼ÅŸÃ¼rmÃ¼ÅŸ oluyoruz.

Bu scripti Ã§alÄ±ÅŸtÄ±rdÄ±ÄŸÄ±mÄ±zda birkaÃ§ dakika iÃ§erisinde ilk keyimizi alÄ±yoruz.

AÅŸama 2 : SO

Ä°lk aÅŸamaya benzer bir dex dosyasÄ± ile karÅŸÄ±laÅŸÄ±yoruz.

Bu sefer jar dosyasÄ± yerine bir adet .so dosyasÄ± oluÅŸturulmasÄ± gerekiyor ve XORlanan indexler deÄŸiÅŸik.

AynÄ± scripti kullanarak zip headeri yerine .so dosyanÄ±n yani ELF headerini \x73\x45\x4c\x46 yazÄ±yoruz, input dosyasÄ±nÄ± mmdffuoscjdamcnssn olarak deÄŸiÅŸtirip ikinici keyimizi de alÄ±yoruz.

AÅŸama 3 Shellkod:

So dosyanÄ± IDA ile aÃ§Ä±p incelediÄŸimizde bu fonksiyonu gÃ¶rebiliyoruz.

Ã–nce asset klasorunden xtszswemcwohpluqmi dosyasÄ± okunuyor ve key hesaplandÄ±ktan sonra bu dosya decrypt ediliyor. Bu sefer biraz olaylar farklÄ±. Keyi hesaplamak iÃ§in fonksiyon ÅŸu ÅŸekilde:

yani :

fonksiyonuna veriliyor ve dosya bu ÅŸekilde decrypt ediliyor. Peki bu sefer neye gÃ¶re decrypt edicez ? Decrypt edildikten sonra bir assembly kodu elde ediceÄŸimiz belli. Ã‡Ã¼nkÃ¼ fonksiyonun devamÄ±nda bu alani fonksiyon ÅŸeklinde Ã§aÄŸrÄ±lÄ±yor.

Bu cepte. Fonksiyon Ã§aÄŸÄ±rÄ±lmadan Ã¶nceki android logâ€™unun bastÄ±ÄŸÄ± deÄŸere baktÄ±ÄŸÄ±mÄ±zda

Jumping to nopsled in 3, 2, 1, ... stringini gÃ¶rÃ¼yoruz. Nop sled ne demekti shellkod demekti. NOP instructionunÄ± shellkod yazan herkes illaki kullanmÄ±ÅŸtÄ±r. Instructionâ€™Ä±n byte karÅŸÄ±lÄ±ÄŸÄ± 0x90. Sled olunca da bundan bir sÃ¼rÃ¼ demek. Decrypt ederken 4byte 4byte gidildiÄŸi iÃ§in encrypted dosyanÄ±n ilk 4 byteÄ±nÄ± 0x90909090 ile XORlarsak keyimizi elde ederiz.

hex(0x90909090^0xfef3b7de) : \x6e\x63\x27\x4e keyini veriyor. Bu key ile dosyayi decrypt etmek istersek :

Key3: \x6e\x63\x27\x4e

OluÅŸan dosyayÄ± ndisasm -b 32 shell_out.dat ÅŸeklinde kontrol edebilirsiniz.

AÅŸama 4 : ROP

En zor kÄ±sÄ±m burasÄ±. Shellkodun ne yaptÄ±ÄŸÄ±nÄ± anlamamÄ±z gerek.

Fonksiyona girmeden Ã¶nce stackteki deÄŸerlerimize bakalÄ±m:

Shellkod Ã§aÄŸÄ±rÄ±lÄ±rken ret adresi de pushlanacaÄŸÄ± iÃ§in stack deÄŸerlerimiz 4 artÄ±yor.

Simdi kodumuz ne yapÄ±yor kabaca bahsedersek:

  • Key hesapla
  • 200-400 arasÄ±nÄ± bu key ile xorla
  • 300den sonrasÄ± iÃ§in shellkodun yÃ¼klendiÄŸi baseâ€™i ekle
  • espâ€™ye 300un offsetini ata
  • ret
  • retâ€™ten sonra kod executionu 300den devam edicek

Åimdi bizim ifâ€™i geÃ§ebilmemiz iÃ§in bu fonksiyondan dÃ¶nen deÄŸerin 0x31337 olmasÄ± lazÄ±m. Åuan gÃ¶rÃ¼nÃ¼rde bu deÄŸer yok. 300â€™e gittikten sonra bu iÅŸi yapmasÄ± lazÄ±m.

200-400 arasÄ±nÄ± XORlayacak keyi bulmak iÃ§in bu aralÄ±ÄŸa bir bakalÄ±m.

BloÄŸun sonuna bakarsanÄ±z hep tekrar eden deÄŸerler gÃ¶rÃ¼yoruz. BloÄŸun baÅŸÄ± iÅŸe anlamsÄ±z datalardan oluÅŸuyor. Burda bloÄŸun sonunun 0x0 lerle bittiÄŸini dÃ¼ÅŸÃ¼nerek XOR keyi olarak 0x42183313 kullandÄ±m.

BloÄŸumuzun baÅŸÄ± rop gadgetleri. AltÄ± ise bu gadgetlarÄ±n adresleri. Disasm bozuk gÃ¶stersede ÅŸu ÅŸekilde :

0x0106 0x0109 0x010d 0x00d9 .. 0x00f3

Bu deÄŸerler espye atanmÄ±ÅŸtÄ±. ret yapÄ±ldÄ±kÃ§a bu deÄŸerler poplana poplana gidicek. Yani bu bizim Ã§alÄ±ÅŸacak kodumuz. Åimdi fonksiyonun 0x31337 dÃ¶nmesini istiyorduk. BakalÄ±m rop chain dÃ¶ndÃ¼rÃ¼yormu. Son offset 0xf3

200â€™u 0 kabul edip hesaplarsak : hex(0xf3-200) : 0x2b . Åimdi yukarÄ±dan 0x2bye bakalÄ±m.

evet istediÄŸimiz deÄŸer dÃ¶nÃ¼yor. Rop iÃ§in key:

AÅŸama 5 : JS

Tabi rop chain sadece 0x31337 dÃ¶ndÃ¼rmÃ¼yor ondan Ã¶ncesinde fonksiyona verilen baÅŸka bir encrypted datayÄ± decrypt ediyor.

Bir html dosyasÄ±. Html dosyasini rop chain oluÅŸturuyor. CaÄŸÄ±rÄ±lan gadgetlara bakalim:

Rotate left yapmadan Ã¶nce ilk aÅŸamada direk gelen xorkeyi kullaniliyor. Bu yÃ¼zden yine xor keyini hesaplayabiliriz. Headerin html olduÄŸunu biliyoruz. Encrypted dosyanÄ±n ilk 4byteâ€™Ä± ile xorlarsak

Key5: = hex(0x3c68746d^0x6a452630): \x56\x2d\x52\x5d

Decryption routinini implemente edicek python scripti yazalim:

Bam.htmli ilk aÃ§tÄ±ÄŸÄ±mÄ±z apk dosyasÄ±ndan hatÄ±rlarsak :

Son aÅŸama olarak flag stringi bu html dosyasÄ±na parametre olarak gidiyor. Html dosyasÄ±nÄ± aÃ§tÄ±ÄŸÄ±mÄ±zda obfuscated bir javascriptle karÅŸÄ±laÅŸÄ±yoruz. theempire_ saolsun bu adÄ±mÄ± tak diye Ã§Ã¶zdÃ¼. Flagin 24. karakterinden sornasinÄ±n => pHd_1w_e4rL13r;)} â€˜a eÅŸit olmasÄ± gerektiÄŸini anlÄ±yoruz.

Elimizde 5 key ve flagin 24-44 arasÄ± karakterleri var.

Biraz kopya cekerek script yazarsak.

flag : OOO{pox&mpuzz,U_solve_it => pHd_1w_e4rL13r;)}

entry.title: DEF CON Quals 2019 : VERYANDROIDOSO
entry.content:
Here is my writeup for VERYANDROIDOSO task. Ofcourse with frida :D

App takes input from us and checks if it is correct flag. Length of flag should be 23 enclosed with OOO{..}. Also inside of brackets only hex [0-9a-f].
18(23-5) divided into 9 part with each part length of 2.

Solverrr

In solver class there are solver, getSecretNumber, scramble(not really), sleep (!):
and exported functions from native-lib:

m0, m1, m2, m3, m4, m6, m7, m8, m9

  • getSecretNumber gets one byte from hash of certificate of application. So its always returns same value to same input.

  • sleep function takes input, and sleep nanosecond*input and returns how much nanosecond is passed (which can be vary).

  • scramble does following :

Looks like it depends on output of sleep function ?

Nope :D because sqrt(4sleep^2)/sleep always returns 2. So overall scramble is same as return (i+2+321)%256
Same as getSecretNumber this function is always returns same value to same input.

  • If you open up ghidra and decompile you can see that m0-m1-m2-m3-m4-m6 doesnâ€™t depend on any value other than its inputs. But
    m7 depends on s1 and s2. m8 depends on s3 and s4. If you look at offset of s4, you can see it is not defined. m9 takes one input and CREATES s4 data.
    So m9 is very important to m8â€™s operations and output. s1, s2 and s3 is already defined in binary and never changed with any other function.

Now comes fun part.

Fridaa

in solve function there are huge if blocks for each input part.

For i1 code is as follows :

To not return false, we need to find correct m0 value . which is m0 & 255 == 172 . iff m0 = 172 . As you can see m0 set with output of m0 function.
So we need to find correct first parameter to m0. How ? frida :D

How did I know second parameter of m0 ?. Lets just give random input : OOO{123456789012345678}

Attach with frida -U --no-pause -f ooo.defcon2019.quals.veryandroidoso -l 1.txt

Then frida outputs :

Scramble 80 13 Secret 113 80

secret function output is 113.

Then I bruteforced all values for m0 in for loop. Frida says m0 should be 53. 53 is input to m0. And we have just 1 option since we ANDed with 255.
If you search m0(53, in jadx you can find i1 == 250. Our first byte is 0xfa . If it is correct then We must see second scramble output in frida.

Try OOO{fa3456789012345678}

Same script gives:

Scramble 80 13 Secret 113 80 Scramble 147 80 Secret 201 147

So it is correct !

For i2 AND

Our condition is m0 & 255 == 6, m0 should be 6. You can find correct secret value same as in step 1. So our for new for loop is :

Add it to frida script. Then output is :
m0 = 53,m1 = 35 => i2 = 180

[250,180]

So far so good.

For i3 :

This time output is ANDed with 251. i10 & 251 == 146 gives two option.

m2 = 7 and m2 = 11 ==> 254 and 52

.
.
.

Overall dc.txt gives :

(Careful here, you should find correct i1 for m0) But since there is no m5 and it just checks over itself you can assign it as correct input.

We have 2*2*16*64 different combination for now.

Bigger plan

After m7 if block, m9(i1+..+i7*i8) is called. This will change s4. Then ONE more if block comes for last hex. Since m8 is dependent on s4 we CANNOT bruteforce like before.

If block :

i10 must be 103.

To find last hex : frida script: 

Iterate over possible inputsClear s4.Calculate input for m9Call m9Find correct value for m8Store solution

Frida can easily handle memory. Calculate all possible values : calc.py

Here t is possible values. Script will find correct input to m8 function. Then you will need to find correct i8. I found older inputs with manual search, but for this case I used python

Now there is just last check !

This time we have all inputs lets just give it to solve function.

Last script

Bypass sleep function so we wont wait.

Fl4g

Now enter something like OOO{123456789012345678} and wait until frida finds correct value ! :D

Flag is hex values of those integers:
OOO{fab43416484944beba}

entry.title: Mobile Malware Analysis : Tricks Used in Anubis
entry.content:
Anubis

Anubis is my first case of complicated android malware and taught me so much about android malware. I want to share these learnings in this post. Anubis is almost one year old but its impact is much higher than older banker families and campaign is still going on. Small section of anubis downloader samples found in play store in between July 2018 and March 2019 :

Anubis is full of tricks. List of capabilities:

  • Steal information with overlay attacks from banking apps
  • Ransomware
  • SMS interception / Call forwarding
  • RAT
  • Keylogger

To spread malware generally google play store is used.

Downloaders

Anubis generally consist of two part. Iâ€™ll call them downloader and payload. If malware spreads over third party sites, such as flash updates it only downloads payload of anubis. But if malware spreads over google play store, it uses downloader. Because it needs to. If payload of anubis is used it will be detected by play protect easily. So to download payload, fake applications deployed on play store. But how an application downloads and installs another application ?
Easy, with REQUEST_INSTALL_PACKAGES permission. I think in the current state of Play Store this permission is dangerous than any other one. Because Play Protect can catch malware and rats if published on play store. Spread of malware generally comes from this permission. Users need to check if this permission is in permission list.

Social Engineering

Malware needs to lower suspicion of user after installation. Anubis downloaders use little but strong steps to make user believe it is legitimate app. Since threat actors want to catch valuable victims, generally these fake applications will be finance related apps. Such as Currency Converter.

Curreny - Gold - EuroCurrency Center

( notice #1 trending )

But these apps will imitate legitimate ones. Here is how earlier fake apps worked. After installing, app will remove itself from homescreen. Why ? Lets say you downloaded an app. But it didnâ€™t worked like you wanted. What you do ? Go back to homescreen and delete that app right ? Now you need to go to settings. Also after opening fake app, generally app will prompt App needs to be updated and forward user to legitimate app that have same app icon, app name and almost same developer name. So you downloaded an app, it forwarded to real one and you installed it. When you go back to your homescreen, you will see only one app which is legitimate one. With this, suspicion of user is lowered. But when you go to settings and list application, you will see 2 of them.

Also ! if you try to remove malware from settings an system error(!) will show up.

System Update ?

After user installs downloader, app will download second stage of attack, payload. Generally name of downloaded apk will be either Sistem Guncellemesi, Operator Guncellemesi, Flash Update, Yazilim Guncellemesi. Names are in Turkish, meaning System Update, Operator Update, Software Update. Icons of these apps:

Flash Player UpdateUpdateOperator UpdateService UpdateSystem Update

With these icons threat actors want user to believe these are legitimate apps. After downloader gets payload app from command and control server, prompt will shown to user. User needs to activate third-party installation and press yes to prompt screen. Then app will installed. After user opens up, app will ask for permissions then nothing will shown and app will dissepear from app list.

Did you see flickering after giving Accessibility permission ? We will come to that.

Persistence

In desktop malware generally malware will write itself to Startup folder to get persistence and open itself each boot. What about Android malware ? Let me introduce you to RECEIVE_BOOT_COMPLETED. With this receiver, app can open itself in background when device is booted. Cool right ?

You cant delete me !

Lets say user gave all permission to application and installed it. But you want to remove app. When you go to settings and try to delete app, you click the app icon. It says System apps cannot be deleted and you are forwarded to user to Home Screen.
What ?

App didnâ€™t take device admin permissions. How it can do that ? Lets find out.

Accessibility

From official android page :â€™Accessibility Services run in the background and receive callbacks by the system when AccessibilityEvents are fired. Such events denote some state transition in the user interface, for example, the focus has changed, a button has been clicked, etc. Such a service can optionally request the capability for querying the content of the active windowâ€˜.

What can go wrong right ?

It can track user activities and have ability to query certain things such as message boxes. Each accessibility event have source component that defines which application triggered current event. There are different event types anubis use :

  • TYPE_VIEW_CLICKED
  • TYPE_VIEW_FOCUSED
  • TYPE_VIEW_TEXT_CHANGED
  • TYPE_WINDOW_STATE_CHANGED

To see what all Accessibility Event types are take a look at : AccessibilityEvent

Anubis tracks all accessibility events and checks event types. So if you open new app window state will change and event will trigger. Event type of TYPE_WINDOW_STATE_CHANGED is first check. To remove malware you probably go to Settings. Settings is also an android application called com.android.settings. Second check is if triggered event comes from com.android.settings. Then malware checks if certain strings in Event description.

First check is for name of the app you clicked :

  • Servis Guncellemesi (this.a.i(this))

Then below strings:

  • uninstall (this.f)
  • to remove (this.g)

If all conditions hold, an Activity is triggered a() . This activity just opens AlertDialog which says System apps cannot be deleted. Since Application doesnt have any Launchable content, android opens alert box in the Homescreen. So whenever you try to open Malwareâ€™s details in Settings you forwarded to homescreen with alert box and you canâ€™t delete app.

Maybe if I remove Accessibility permission from app, I should able to remove it right ? No. Lets say you removed permission. Allâ€™s fine. But when you open Settings again, malware will constantly ask you to give permission. You cant navigate to Apps section of Settings to remove app. Fine, maybe If I reboot then I can remove app ? Remember RECEIVE_BOOT_COMPLETED permission ? App will start again and ask for Accessibility permission. But you have other ways to remove the app. If you have application manager apps with package name other than com.android.settings you can delete malware. Or by booting in safe mode. Also if you have adb enabled and you know packagename you can delete it with : adb uninstall packagename. To learn package names you can list all packages with adb shell pm list packages

Keylogger

Now we covered TYPE_WINDOW_STATE_CHANGED event. Lets look at other 3 event.

  • TYPE_VIEW_CLICKED
  • TYPE_VIEW_FOCUSED
  • TYPE_VIEW_TEXT_CHANGED

EVERY input box you click/focus and write text into it, will trigger one the three event. No matter what app you are in. So lets say TYPE_VIEW_TEXT_CHANGED event triggered and malware caught it. With just obj = accessibilityEvent.getText().toString(); it can get changed text and send back to its command and control server. Event type 16 = TYPE_VIEW_TEXT_CHANGED

Remember flickering after giving the accessibility permission to malware ? With accessibility, app can press buttons (yes literally). Malware press yes without user interaction.

You guessed right, action 16 is ACTION_CLICK and this.e holds StringYes.

Play Protect

Even though malware installed on the device from downloader without being flagged, Play Protect will constantly scan the device if its enabled and will flag anubis app as a malware. To overcome this malware tries to disable Play protect.

Package List

When malware installed, first thing it does is listing installed packages and sending it to command and control server. These application names are sometimes used for another purpose. For example when threat actor knows you have, lets say â€˜com.x.bankâ€™ app, threat actor sends sms that crafted for that app to lure user to open com.x.bank application. You have received 10.000$. Login in to your X account With this technique user will open that app and fake overlay will shown. This can be taught as backup plan for phishing user.

How can android app list installed packages ? Easy getInstalledApplications

Overlay Attack

Malware authors always try to find creative ways to fool victims to get their information. Overlay attack is one of them. Since early 2016 (MazarBot ) a lot of android malware used this technique for collecting user information. When targeted apps opened, malware triggers and pulls phishing page that generated for that targeted app from command and control server and overlays over targeted app. Showing it is easier.

(random banking app is chosen. There are 100+ targeted apps)

Since overlayed screen is similar to original app and process of overlaying is done in very short time, user probably dont get suspicious. But how malware detects opened apps and overlays itself on top of another process ? Lets find out !

Process Scanning

Getting package list is not enough for overlay attack. Malware needs to know that user just opened â€œcom.x.bankâ€ app to make believable overlay scenerio. Or user wont fall it and be suspicious about it. There is no â€œan app openedâ€ service in android. The way malware does is simple: somehow get running process list and get top process. Put that function in While(true){ } loop. This way you will know when new app opened. The ways of getting process list differs in targeted SDK versions. Anubis need permission to get process list if API version is greater than 23. It uses PACKAGE_USAGE_STATS permission to use UsageStatsManager and get list of running processes. If API version is < 23 then there are functions to get list of processes without any permission. Iâ€™ll focus on this topic on my next post. After getting process/package names, malware compare these with banking apps package names. Then opens up corresponding phishing page through webView. This action doesnâ€™t need any permission. Any app can open itself without user interaction ! (Not in Android 9 YAY !)

Then collected data will be send to command and control server.

Battery issues

But running in forever loop will cause some battery issues right? Battery optimizing apps will close malware. Malware author was aware of this and here comes another permission REQUEST_IGNORE_BATTERY_OPTIMIZATIONS. With this permission app will not seen in battery optimizations.

SMS Interception and Call forwarding

This is scary part. Malware already have SMS_READ permission for reading sms. Why ? For OTP codes. Addition to reading, malware requests for being default SMS app. If user accepts, threat actor behind the command and control server can delete SMS from device. Then sms will be removed and user wont have any clue.

Call forwarding, oh this is really scary. Lets say bank understood user is victim of malware. Calls him/her number. But who opens the phone ? threat actor.

Conclusion

Two permission for two stages of anubis. REQUEST_INSTALL_PACKAGES and PACKAGE_USAGE_STATS these are releated to core components of the malware to fool user. I hope you learned something new about android malware. If you have any question feel free to ask me @0xabc0

While writing this post, Android announced 9 beta with great security related news ! Now apps canâ€™t open itself without user interaction, no more overlay tactics for malware !

Reference

Anubis Image gregory-the-gregory

Readings

Anubis Related:
Koodous for finding anubis sample
LukasStefankoâ€™s twitter thread
Trend Microâ€™s post about Anubis
IBM X-Forceâ€™s post about Anubis
Sophos Labsâ€™ post about Anubis

If you want to read related posts about android malware heres my other posts:
How to defeat packers in Android ecosystem
How to setup android malware analysis lab (in Turkish)

entry.content:
basitmobil

jadxte aÃ§tÄ±ÄŸÄ±mda flag zaten karÅŸÄ±mda.

ApkyÄ± jebâ€™de aÃ§Ä±yorum gÃ¶rÃ¼yorumki .flag.txt diye bir dosya oluÅŸturuyor. Ä°Ã§ine de binary->octal->decimal dÃ¶nÃ¼ÅŸÃ¼mÃ¼nÃ¼ yapÄ±p deÄŸeri yazÄ±yor.

Dosyaya bakmadan direk datayÄ± alÄ±p binary -> asci deÄŸerini de bakabilirsiniz. Dosyaya adb shell ile emulatore baÄŸlanÄ±p bakalÄ±m. (v24 istiyor ona gÃ¶re vm aÃ§mak lazÄ±m)

Bu binary deÄŸerleri sahteymiÅŸ demekki apknÄ±n baÅŸka bir yerinde baÅŸka binary deÄŸerleri var.

jadxte apkyÄ± aÃ§Ä±yorum. GÃ¶rÃ¼yorumki bir karÅŸÄ±laÅŸtÄ±rma var. Uygulama bu karÅŸÄ±laÅŸtÄ±rmaya gÃ¶re apkdeki bir componente setText ile text basÄ±yor.

KarÅŸÄ±latÄ±rmanÄ±n yapÄ±ldÄ±ÄŸÄ± kod parÃ§asÄ± ÅŸu ÅŸekilde

Base64.encodeToString( Util.a( obj,Util.a( new String( Base64.decode( MainActivity.this.getString(R.string.b),0)))), 0).trim().equals( MainActivity.this.getString(R.string.a)) != null

Yani ifâ€™i iÃ§inde ÅŸu karÅŸÄ±latÄ±rma yapÄ±lÄ±yor.

R.string.a deÄŸerini biliyoruz : UmxUbYYSllDKA1n+ZMR/sZXJ5ZglWOSfYGzfuVauT+o=

first ve second iÃ§in Util classÄ±na bakalÄ±m

Birden fazla a fonksiyonu var. first ve second iÃ§in hangi a fonksiyonun Ã§alÄ±ÅŸacaÄŸÄ±nÄ± parametre sayÄ±sÄ± belirleyecek. First iÃ§in tek deÄŸerli yani md5li fonksiyon, second iÃ§in alttaki aes encryption fonksiyonu Ã§alÄ±ÅŸacak.
firstâ€™Ã¼n gittiÄŸi fonksiyon gelen deÄŸerin md5ini alÄ±p dÃ¶nen deÄŸerin 16 karaterini alÄ±yor.

secondâ€™Ä±n gittiÄŸi a fonksiyonun ilk parametrisi str, ikinci parametresi key. Bu parametrelerle ECB modunda aes encryption yapÄ±yor.

yani first deÄŸerimiz md5(R.string.b)[:16] , bu deÄŸer de aes encryptiona key olarak gidiyor.

secondâ€™Ä±n gittiÄŸi fonksiyonun ilk parametresi apkdan gelen input deÄŸeri. Bu deÄŸeri alÄ±p constant key ile encrypt edip base64Ã¼nÃ¼ aldÄ±ÄŸÄ±mÄ±zda R.string.a deÄŸeriyle aynÄ± deÄŸeri bulmamÄ±z gerek. Tersten gidersek

base64decode(R.string.a) yÄ± md5(R.string.b)[:16] ile decrypt edince flage ulaÅŸabiliriz.

Flag : STMCTF{!ben_evdey1m_zaten}

muslukcu

apkyÄ± jadxte aÃ§Ä±nca gÃ¶rÃ¼nÃ¼yorki sÃ¼rekli bir log.d akÄ±ÅŸÄ± var. STMCTF{ stringini arayÄ±nca tek bir yerde geÃ§tiÄŸini gÃ¶rÃ¼yorum ve koda gidiyorum.

skor deÄŸiÅŸkenine baktÄ±ÄŸÄ±mda aslÄ±nda constant oldugunu gÃ¶rÃ¼yorum. Oyundaki skor score deÄŸiÅŸkeninde tutuluyor. Geriye touchx deÄŸeri kalÄ±yor. Bu deÄŸer ekrana tÄ±klandÄ±ÄŸÄ±nda deÄŸiÅŸiyor aslÄ±nda. Ama flagi hesaplarken ilk deÄŸeri olan 1000â€™i almak gerekiyor.
Bu bilgilerden sonra 2 yol kullanabiliriz.

  • Elle hesaplama
  • Gerekli conditionâ€™Ä± saÄŸlayÄ±p flagi log.d ye bastÄ±rabiliriz.

Elle hesaplarsanÄ±z .

STMCTF{} iÃ§ine koydugunuzda yarÄ±ÅŸmadaki flage ulaÅŸÄ±yorsunuz.

ANCAK

Bu deÄŸer bir integer deÄŸiÅŸkeninin tutabilceÄŸi deÄŸerden yani 0xffffffff â€˜den fazla. Yani aslÄ±nda i deÄŸeri 5000 olduÄŸunda apkâ€™nÄ±n log.d ye basacaÄŸÄ± deÄŸer farklÄ± bir deÄŸer.
Bunu frida ile deneyebiliriz.

Kodum ÅŸu ÅŸekilde :

i deÄŸerini 5000 yapÄ±yorum. Kodun olduÄŸu fonksiyon sÃ¼rekli Ã§aÄŸÄ±rÄ±ldÄ±ÄŸÄ± iÃ§in trigger etmeme gerek yok. Ã‡aÄŸÄ±rÄ±lmasaydÄ± instance.checkLife() ekleyerek bunu saÄŸlayabilirdik.
DeÄŸer deÄŸiÅŸtikten sonra condition saÄŸlandÄ±ÄŸÄ± iÃ§in bana log.d den flagi vermesi lazÄ±m.

cokzararli

entry.title: Flareon5 #6 Challenge : Magic
entry.content:
In this post Iâ€™ll try to explain how I bruteforced challenge 6 with frida.

First of all lets try to understand what binary does.

Binary will take 666 input. Follow the flow of the program, it goes to sub_402dcf after taking input from user.

In sub_402dcf, program iterates 0x21 times.

It checks size of input with 0x40. If its less than 0x40 program goes to sub_402cc7 and exits. I should avoid sub_402cc7.

Each iteration program goes to 0x605100 + 0x120*i and take somethings. Lets look at structure for first iteration (0x605100)

0x400c55,0x147,0x02,0x03,0x25,0x61385a â€¦

Firstly it takes 0x400c55 (first region) and 0x61385a (second region) and 0x147(size) . It xors first region with second region. After that it calls first region at 0x402f06 (call rcx).

If you look at size of â€œAâ€s in rax ,it says 61 times but I entered 63 times and remember 0x2 from first structure. So 0x2 is index of string. Also see 0x3 at rsi register. After analyzing 0x400c55 it turns out 0x3 is our length.

What I learned so far.

  • Key size is 69, (max number at structure 0x42+3)
  • Before call rcx, program xors region by getting parameters from structure.
  • Call rcx is taking length and index of strings which comes from structure.
  • If its correct program goes to next iteration, so probably different function will be executed for checking input.

I tried to understand each function. I reversed 3 functions but stuck at 4th. (turns out it was base64). Then I looked at structure, and saw each function takes only 1-3 length.
So why not bruteforce it ? Since I love frida and never tried instrumentation on linux binaries lets give it a shot.

First lets learn how functions called with frida. If functions exported you can define NativeFunction with

NativeFunction(Module.findExportByName(null,'printf'), 'pointer', []);

But I will use functions that arenâ€™t exported. So I will give pointer to NativeFunction such as:

var xor = new NativeFunction( ptr(0x402CDF), 'void', ['pointer', 'pointer', 'pointer']);

First parameter is pointer to beginning of routine. Second parameter is type of what function will return. Third parameter is types of parameter which function will accept.

Lets try it

I defined 2 functions, first one xor routine other one is where our input checked. Second routine returns int, After that I set a Interceptor to see registers before getting into function.
You can write into memory with Memory.writeS* . First parameter is pointer , second is what you want to write. You read locations as a string with readUtf8String function.
I give 7 parameter to fnc1 to see state of registers. Attach to binary with frida magic -l brute.js

So order of parameters is : rdi,rsi,rdx,rcx,r8,r9..
I used this to understand which register my parameter goes.

Now I can define functions with pointers, write strings to memory and read memory. So I have everything I need.

Before bruteforcing lets parse structure, open all functions with xor.

Define our pools with len 1, 2 and 3 for bruteforcing

Get parameters from s and bruteforce functions.

I defined fnc1 NativeFunction which checks user input.
Lastly wrap all script into

because if I dont it will timeout.

So running this script will give this.

Looks promising. BUT script couldnâ€™t find 2 string. Even now I dont know why it doesnt find it. Maybe some register values doesnt fit idk. Since I was so close to finding first key, I tried to bypass checks and looked program at gdb.

Lets put breakpoint at after call rcx (0x402F0a) and 0x403B6C which is after all input is checked. Give string to program and if doesnt correct bypass next check by setting eax 1.

Annd whoa. After hitting 0x403b6c, you can see â€œAh, there is nothi like the hot winds of He blowing in your face.â€ . Turns out program shuffled our input to create meaningfull string.

Googleing sentence and blanks filled with â€œng â€œ and â€œllâ€. This is good. If my script cant find string with len 2, I can say its â€œllâ€ , if len is 3 its â€œng â€œ.

After giving correct input to binary, without knowing what program does I attached my frida script again. And whoila again I found string. And pool of letters is same.

So I know now, each key is shuffled, and shuffled parts are same. And I can lower my pool to this :

My plan is set my frida script such that it will find correct key, send to binary, and again again.. for each key. I will use python helper for that.

I will start magic and my frida script same time. Get key from frida and send to binary.

I will wrap my frida script to timeout so it will execute after given time (70ms).

Running sol.py

It was fun to use frida. I learned a lot from this challenge. :)

entry.title: BLE'nin ABCsi : 2 - MITM
entry.content:
Serimizin ilk yazÄ±sÄ±nda BLEâ€™nin temellerini Ã¶ÄŸrendiÄŸimize gÃ¶re artÄ±k BLE kullanan cihazlara yapÄ±labilecek saldÄ±rÄ± tekniklerinden bahsebiliriz. Bir BLE cihazÄ±mÄ±z olsun. Bu cihazÄ±mÄ±zla genellikle mobil telefonlardaki veya bilgisayara yÃ¼klediÄŸimiz uygulamalar ile konuÅŸuruz.

  • Android iÃ§in telefonun kurduÄŸu baÄŸlantÄ±lardaki bluetooth trafiÄŸini loglayabilmek iÃ§in Bluetooth HCI gÃ¶zetleme gÃ¼nlÃ¼ÄŸÃ¼ Ã¶zelliÄŸini aÃ§abilirsiniz.
  • IOS iÃ§in bu iÅŸlem biraz zor. AraÅŸtÄ±rmama raÄŸmen cihazdaki bluetooth trafiÄŸini dumplayabilceÄŸim bi araÃ§ bulamadÄ±m. EÄŸer bilen varsa yorum kÄ±smÄ±nÄ± yeÅŸillendirebilir. https://developer.apple.com/documentation/corebluetooth adresinden class isimlerini bulup, bu fonksiyonlarÄ± Frida ile hooklayarak yarÄ±m bir baÅŸarÄ± elde ettim ancak tatmin edici olmadÄ± : frida

Android iÃ§in bluetooth ve ble cihazlarla iletiÅŸim kurabileceÄŸimiz, nRF Connect adÄ±nda uygulama bulunmakta. KurmanÄ±zÄ± Ã¶neririm.

BunlarÄ±n dÄ±ÅŸÄ±nda yapabileceÄŸimiz saldÄ±rÄ± tekniklerini kabaca 3â€™e ayÄ±rabiliriz:

  • Man in the middle (MITM)
  • Sniffing
  • Firmware dump

Ne iÃ§in kullanacaÄŸÄ±mÄ±zÄ± kÄ±saca aÃ§Ä±klarsak:

  • MITMâ€™Ä± BLE link layerâ€™da encryption kullanmayan cihazlara karÅŸÄ± kullanacaÄŸÄ±z.
  • Sniffingâ€™i encryption yapmÄ±ÅŸ cihazlara karÅŸÄ± kullanacaÄŸÄ±z.
  • Firmware dump ile hedef cihazÄ±mÄ±zÄ±n kullandÄ±ÄŸÄ± tÃ¼m kodlarÄ± bulacaÄŸÄ±z. Ã–zellikle gizli, dokumante edilmemiÅŸ Ã¶zel kodlarÄ± :)

Bu yazÄ±da MITM, gelecek yazÄ±larda da diÄŸer teknikleri anlatmaya Ã§alÄ±ÅŸacaÄŸÄ±m.
Her teknik iÃ§in ufak ekipmanlar almamÄ±z gerekecek :)

MITM

Gereksinimler:

  • ESP32 $12
  • Raspberry Pi $50
  • Bluetooth dongle $10

Bu teknik iÃ§in 2 adet Bluetooth kullanan cihaza ihtiyacÄ±mÄ±z var. Kendi bilgisyarÄ±mÄ±z ve bir adet Raspberry Pi. Bluetooth MAC adresinizi deÄŸiÅŸtirebiliyorsanÄ±z dongle almanÄ±za gerek yok. RPI lazÄ±m Ã§Ã¼nkÃ¼ bir bilgisayarda iki adet bluetooth clientâ€™Ä± Ã§alÄ±ÅŸtÄ±rmak neredeyse imkansÄ±z.

Temel olarak saldÄ±rÄ± topolojimiz ÅŸu ÅŸekilde:

Hedef cihazÄ±mÄ±z raspberry piâ€™ye baÄŸlandÄ±ÄŸÄ± iÃ§in advertisement yapmayacak. Biz de bundan faydalanÄ±p o cihazmÄ±ÅŸÄ±z gibi advertisement yapÄ±caz. KullanÄ±cÄ± hedef cihaza baÄŸlandÄ±ÄŸÄ±nÄ± dÃ¼ÅŸÃ¼nerek bizim kurduÄŸumuz sahte cihaza baÄŸlanÄ±cak.

Kaliâ€™de kurduÄŸumuz sahte BLE, hedef cihazdaki tÃ¼m Ã¶zelliklerin aynÄ±sÄ±nÄ± taÅŸÄ±yacak, hatta cihazla aynÄ± MAC adresini de. DÄ±ÅŸardan bakan biri iÃ§in sahte cihazÄ±mÄ±z ve gerÃ§ek cihaz arasÄ±nda bir fark olmayacak. KullanÄ±cÄ±nÄ±n yolladÄ±ÄŸÄ± tÃ¼m datayÄ± kaliâ€™den raspberry piâ€™ye yollayacaÄŸÄ±z. Raspberry pi da gelen datayÄ± hedef cihazÄ±mÄ±za yollayacak. Hedef cihazdan dÃ¶nen data da aynÄ± ÅŸekilde kullanÄ±cÄ±ya geri dÃ¶necek. BÃ¶ylece kimse farkÄ±na varmadan aradan geÃ§en tÃ¼m datayÄ± inceleme fÄ±rsatÄ±nÄ± elde etmiÅŸ olacaÄŸÄ±z.

TÃ¼m bu iÅŸlemleri yapan halihazÄ±rda geliÅŸtirilmiÅŸ 2 toolumuz bulunmakta. GATTacker ve btlejuice. GATTacker komple komut satÄ±rÄ±nda Ã§alÄ±ÅŸmakta. Btlejuice ise web arayÃ¼zÃ¼nde Ã§alÄ±ÅŸmakta. GATTackerâ€™Ä± bir cihaz Ã¼stÃ¼nde baÅŸarÄ±yla kullandÄ±m. Ancak BLECTF iÃ§in kullandÄ±ÄŸÄ±m ESP32â€™de iÅŸe yaramadÄ±.
Btlejuice ise her iki cihazda da Ã§alÄ±ÅŸtÄ±. O yÃ¼zden bu yazÄ±da btlejuice kullanacaÄŸÄ±z.

Raspberry

microSD kartÄ±ma raspian imajÄ± atÄ±p raspberry piâ€™yi ayaÄŸa kaldÄ±rdÄ±m. SSH ile baÄŸlanabilmek iÃ§in imajÄ±n iÃ§ine boÅŸ bir txt dosyasÄ± koyup adÄ±nÄ± ssh yaptÄ±m. Raspberry piâ€™yi ethernet kablosu ile modeme baÄŸlayÄ±p, ipâ€™sini bulduktan sonra ssh ile baÄŸlandÄ±m. Default pi:raspberry credleri ile cihaza girdim. VNC server baÅŸlatÄ±p, servera baÄŸlandÄ±m. Raspberry piâ€™yi proxy olarak kullanacaÄŸÄ±z. Bir klasor oluÅŸturup sudo npm install -g btlejuice ile btlejuiceâ€™i yÃ¼kledim. (eÄŸer npmde sÄ±kÄ±ntÄ± yaÅŸarsanÄ±z npm 8 kurun ÅŸu linkten)

Proxyâ€™i node node_modules/btlejuice/bin/cmd_btlejuice_proxy.js ile baÅŸlatÄ±yoruz.

Kali

Kalide de aynÄ± ÅŸekilde btlejuiceâ€™i kurup bu sefer sudo node node_modules/btlejuice/bin/cmd_btlejuice.js -u <Raspberry IP address> -w komutunu Ã§alÄ±ÅŸtÄ±rÄ±yoruz.

ArdÄ±ndan kaliâ€™de browser aÃ§Ä±p localhost:8080â€™e gidiyoruz. SaÄŸ Ã¼stten bluetooth iÅŸaretine bastÄ±ÄŸÄ±mÄ±zda cihazlarÄ± ÅŸekilde listeliyorsa iÅŸlem tamam demektir. Ä°ÅŸaretlediÄŸim cihaz ayarlayacaÄŸÄ±mÄ±z ESP32mizin ismi olacak.

ESP32

Ã–nceki yazÄ±da kullandÄ±ÄŸÄ±m ESP32â€™ye yeni kod yÃ¼kleyip, ufak bir sistem kurdum. Bu sefer kod yÃ¼klemek iÃ§in Arduino IDE kullandÄ±m. ESP32â€™nin c kÃ¼tÃ¼phanesini cppâ€™ye aktarÄ±p Arduinoya geÃ§irmiÅŸ abilerimiz. Arduinoâ€™ya esp32 kÃ¼tÃ¼phanelerini eklemek iÃ§in ÅŸu linki takip edebilirsiniz.

Kod olarak ÅŸunu kullandÄ±m.

Kodumuz karakteristiÄŸimize ÅŸifre olarak Secr3tP4ssw0rd gÃ¶nderdiÄŸimizde 4 numaralÄ± pini, farklÄ± bir ÅŸifre gÃ¶nderdiÄŸimizde 5 numaralÄ± pini 500 milisaniye boyunca yakmakta. Arduino IDE ile esp32mize kodu yÃ¼klÃ¼yoruz.

Devre ÅŸemamÄ±zda ÅŸu ÅŸekilde :

Devreyi de kurduktan sonra geriye datayÄ± intercept etmek kalÄ±yor :)

ATIL KURT

TÃ¼m setupâ€™Ä± kurduktan sonra btlejuice arayÃ¼zÃ¼nde en saÄŸdaki seÃ§eneÄŸe tÄ±klayÄ±p tikleri kaldÄ±rÄ±n yoksa handlelarÄ±mÄ±zÄ± karÄ±ÅŸtÄ±rÄ±yor biraz. ArdÄ±ndan bluetooth iÅŸaretine tÄ±klayÄ±n. Komut satÄ±rÄ±mÄ±zda ÅŸunlarÄ± gÃ¶rdÃ¼yseniz tamamdÄ±r.


EÄŸer tikleri kaldÄ±rmazsanÄ±z iÅŸaretlediÄŸim yer yerine bi Ã¼st infodaki Fixing Bleno handles mesajÄ±nÄ± gÃ¶rÃ¼rsÃ¼nÃ¼z ve nRF Connect tÃ¼m handlelarÄ± gÃ¶remez.
ArdÄ±ndan telefonunzdan nrf connect uygulamasÄ±nÄ± aÃ§Ä±p MITMME cihazÄ±na baÄŸlanÄ±nÄ±n.

Åimdi handleâ€™Ä±mÄ±za yanlÄ±ÅŸ ÅŸifre girip kÄ±rmÄ±zÄ± Ä±ÅŸÄ±ÄŸÄ±n yandÄ±ÄŸÄ±nÄ± gÃ¶rÃ¼n. Bir de doÄŸru ÅŸifreyi yollayÄ±p sarÄ± Ä±ÅŸÄ±ÄŸÄ± yakÄ±n.
Son olarakta btljuice arayÃ¼zÃ¼ne baktÄ±ÄŸÄ±nÄ±zda karÅŸÄ±nÄ±zda gÃ¶nderdiÄŸiniz datalarÄ± gÃ¶rÃ¼ceksiniz :)


Giden datayÄ± intercept edebiliriz. DoÄŸru ÅŸifre girildiÄŸi halde bunu yanlÄ±ÅŸa Ã§evirebiliriz.

Real life Ã¶rneklerden biri : https://blog.attify.com/btlejuice-mitm-attack-smart-bulb/

Serinin bir sonraki yazÄ±sÄ±nda pairingâ€™i pin ile yapacaÄŸÄ±z. Link layerimizi encrypt edip bu trafiÄŸe saldÄ±rmayÄ± deneyeceÄŸiz. GÃ¶rÃ¼ÅŸmek Ã¼zere :)

entry.title: BLE'nin ABCsi : 1 - Basics
entry.content:
Bu seride Bluetooth Low Energy hakkÄ±nda Ã¶ÄŸrendiÄŸim ne varsa anlatmaya Ã§alÄ±ÅŸacaÄŸÄ±m. Ä°lk olarak protokoldeki temel kavramlarÄ± anlatÄ±p ardÄ±ndan bu kavramlarÄ± uygulamalÄ± olarak pekiÅŸtirebileceÄŸimiz https://github.com/hackgnar/ble_ctf BLECTF â€˜in Ã§Ã¶zÃ¼mlerinden bahsedeceÄŸim. Sonraki yazÄ±mda da BLE cihazlarÄ±n gÃ¼venliÄŸine ve saldÄ±rÄ± tekniklerine deÄŸineceÄŸim.

Temel Bilgiler

Bluetooth Low Energy yani BLE. Ä°lk olarak Bluetooth 4.0 ile 2011â€™de karÅŸÄ±mÄ±za Ã§Ä±ktÄ±. Klasik Bluetooth ile BLEâ€™nin farklarÄ±nÄ± bir tabloya dÃ¶kecek olursak;

|Ã–zellik | Bluetooth | BLE |
| :â€” | :â€”: | :â€”: |
| Network/Topology | Scatternet | Star Bus |
| Enerji TÃ¼ketimi | Az (< 30mA) | Ã‡ok az ( <15mA) |
| HÄ±z | 700 Kbps | 1 Mbps |
| Menzil | < 30m | 50 metre.AÃ§Ä±k alanda 150 |
| RF FrekansÄ± | 2400 MHz | 2400 MHz |
| Frekans kanallarÄ± | 79 kanal | 40 kanal(3 advertising)|
| Gecikme | 100ms | 3ms|

Klasik Bluetooth devamlÄ± veri akÄ±ÅŸÄ± iÃ§in tasarlanmÄ±ÅŸtÄ±. BLE ise uzun aralÄ±klarla ani (burst) veri akÄ±ÅŸÄ± iÃ§in tasarlanmÄ±ÅŸ. Mesela arabadaki mÃ¼zik Ã§alara Bluetooth ile baÄŸlanÄ±p mÃ¼zik aktarÄ±rken sÃ¼rekli bir veri akÄ±ÅŸÄ± var ancak bluetoothla Ã§alÄ±ÅŸan bir lamba butonu siz aÃ§/kapa komutu gÃ¶nderdiÄŸiniz sÃ¼re boyunca Ã§alÄ±ÅŸmakta.

BLE sayesinde IOT cihazlardaki enerji tÃ¼ketimi hatrÄ± sayÄ±lÄ±r bir ÅŸekilde azaldÄ±. Bu yÃ¼zden IOT cihazlarda klasik Bluetooth yerine BLE kullanÄ±lmakta.

TÃ¼m BLE cihazlar GATT (Generic Attribute Profile) kullanmakta. GATTâ€™ta karÅŸÄ±mÄ±za Ã§Ä±kan terimlerden bahsedecek olursak:

  • Client : GATT komutlarÄ±nÄ± ve isteklerini baÅŸlatan, isteklere gelen cevaplarÄ± kabul eden cihaz. Telefon, Bilgisayar gibi
  • Server : GATT komutlarÄ±nÄ± ve isteklerini alan, cevaplarÄ± yollayan cihazlar. IsÄ± sensÃ¶rÃ¼ gibi
  • Characteristic : Client ve Server arasÄ±nda aktarÄ±lan data deÄŸeri. Pildeki voltaj miktarÄ±
  • Properties : Her karakteriÄŸin Ã¶zellikleri vardÄ±r. READ, WRITE, NOTIFY gibi gibi
  • Service : Benzer karakteristiklerin toplu hali. Mesela termometre serviceâ€™i, Ä±sÄ± deÄŸerini ve Ã¶lÃ§Ã¼mler arasÄ±ndaki zamana ait karakteristiÄŸi tutabilir.
  • Descriptor : Karakteristik hakkÄ±nda bilgi. IsÄ± deÄŸeri olarak Celcius kullanÄ±lacaksa o karakteristikteki descriptora Celcius yazÄ±labilir.
  • Identifier : Services, descriptors, ve karakteristiklerin hepsinin bir UUIDâ€™si vardÄ±r. Bu UUIDâ€™lere identifier denir.

BLECTF

Bu kadar teori yeter biraz elimizi kirletme vakti geldi. https://github.com/hackgnar/ble_ctf adresinde hoÅŸmu hoÅŸ bir CTF tarzÄ± olayÄ±mÄ±z var. BLEâ€™ye baÅŸlamak iÃ§in birebir.

Bir adet ESP32 ile ile CTFâ€™e baÅŸlayabiliyoruz. TÃ¼rkiyede biraz pahalÄ±ya denk geliyor. Ben ÅŸu adresteki cihazÄ± satÄ±n aldÄ±m. Birde 20-30 lira arasÄ±nda bir Bluetooth dongle almanÄ±zÄ± Ã¶neririm.

CTFte sadece 1 flagi almak iÃ§in mac adresini deÄŸiÅŸtirmemiz gerekiyor. BilgisayarÄ±nÄ±zda gelen Bluetooth chiplerinin mac adresini genelde deÄŸiÅŸtiremiyorsunuz. Denemek isterseniz :
Ã–nce hciconfig yazÄ±p sisteminizdeki bluetoothlarÄ± listeleyin. Benim dongle da takÄ±lÄ± olduÄŸu iÃ§in 2 cihaz gÃ¶zÃ¼kÃ¼yor.

ArdÄ±ndan denemek istediÄŸiniz cihazÄ± hciconfig hciX up ile Ã§alÄ±ÅŸÄ±r hale getirin ve
bdaddr -i hciX 11:22:33:44:55:66 ile mac adresini deÄŸiÅŸtirmeye Ã§alÄ±ÅŸÄ±n. EÄŸer benim gibi hata alÄ±yorsanÄ±z mac adresi deÄŸiÅŸmiyor demektir :(

BLE hackingle uÄŸraÅŸÄ±caksanÄ±z mac adresini deÄŸiÅŸtirmeniz Ã§ok iÅŸinize yarÄ±yacak, Ã¶zellikle Man in the Middle Attack yaparken :)

ROM Flashing

esp32yi flashlamadan Ã¶nce bilgisayarÄ±nÄ±za esp toolcahini kurmanÄ±z gerekiyor.
http://esp-idf.readthedocs.io/en/latest/get-started/#setup-toolchain adresinde ortamÄ±nÄ±za gÃ¶re instructionlara takip ederek toolchaini kurun

ArdÄ±ndan ctfi hazÄ±rlayan abimizin githubâ€™Ä±nÄ± clonelayÄ±n. git clone https://github.com/hackgnar/ble_ctf/ . KlonladÄ±ktan sonra sÄ±rayla:

  • cd ble_ctf
  • make menuconfig
  • make
  • Bir sonraki adÄ±mdan Ã¶nce esp32yi usb ile bilgisayarÄ±nÄ±za baÄŸlayÄ±n
  • make flash

Gelsin Flagler

CLI toollarÄ± olarak hcitool, bleah, bluetoothctl ve gatttool kullanÄ±caz. Kendi linux daÄŸÄ±tÄ±mÄ±nÄ±za gÃ¶re bu toollarÄ± kurmaya Ã§alÄ±ÅŸÄ±n.
ESP32mizle iletiÅŸim kurabilmemiz iÃ§in Ã¶ncelikle MAC adresini bulmamÄ±z gerekiyor. Bunun iÃ§in hcitool scan deÄŸil hcitool lescan komutunu kullanÄ±yoruz. Ã‡Ã¼nkÃ¼ esp32miz BLE kullanÄ±yor.

GÃ¶rdÃ¼ÄŸÃ¼nÃ¼z Ã¼zere esp32miz BLECTF diyerek advertising yapmakta. Mac adresini kopyaladÄ±ktan sonra sudo bleah -b "30:AE:A4:05:4F:E6"-e ile ÅŸu ekran gÃ¶rÃ¼ntÃ¼sÃ¼nÃ¼ alabiliyoruz.

Bu ekranda yazÄ±nÄ±n ilk kÄ±smÄ±nda bahsettiÄŸimiz service, karakteristik ve descriptorlarÄ± gÃ¶rebilirsiniz. Skorumuz 0x2a handlelÄ± karakteristiÄŸimizde tutuluyor. EÄŸer o karakteristiÄŸi gatttool ile okumak istiyorsak :
gatttool -b 30:AE:A4:05:4F:E6 --char-read -a 0x002a|awk -F':' '{print $2}'|tr -d ' '|xxd -r -p;printf '\n' ile okuyabiliyoruz.

gatttool help ile toolumuzun parametreleri hakkÄ±nda bilgi edinebilirsiniz. --char-readâ€˜i okuma , --char-writeâ€˜Ä± da yazma iÅŸleri iÃ§in kullanÄ±caz.
Flagleri 0x2c numaralÄ± handleâ€™a 20 karakter uzunlugunda yolluyoruz.

Github sayfasÄ±nda ilk flagimiz iÃ§in https://github.com/hackgnar/ble_ctf/blob/master/docs/hints/flag1.md hint bÄ±rakmÄ±ÅŸ abimiz.

Ä°lk flagimizi girmek iÃ§in gatttool -b 30:AE:A4:05:4F:E6 --char-write-req -a 0x002c -n $(echo -n "12345678901234567890"|xxd -ps) komutunu giriyoruz.

Tekrar flag sayacÄ±mÄ±zÄ± okudugumuzda : Score:1 /20 olduÄŸunu gÃ¶rÃ¼yoruz YEY

GirdiÄŸimiz komutlarÄ±n Ã§oÄŸunu tekrar tekrar kullanÄ±caÄŸÄ±mÄ±z iÃ§in bash scripti yazmamÄ±z Ã§ok hoÅŸ olur.
Default handle olarak scoreâ€™un handleâ€™Ä±nÄ± kullanan, parametre verdiÄŸimizde ise verdiÄŸimiz handleâ€™Ä± kullanan bir bash scripti yazalÄ±m.

read.sh olarak kaydettim.

SÃ¼per. Birde bunu write iÃ§in yapalÄ±m. Ä°lk parametremiz yazÄ±lacak deÄŸeri, ikinci parametre de hangi handleâ€™a yazÄ±lacaÄŸÄ±nÄ± belirlesin. EÄŸer 2. parametreye deÄŸer girmezsek flag girdiÄŸimiz handleâ€™a yazsÄ±n.

bunu da write.sh olarak kaydettim.

0x2e de zaten 20 karakterlik md5 gÃ¶zÃ¼kmekte. Hemen onu flag olarak yazÄ±yoruz.

3.flagimiz device adÄ±nÄ±n md5i.

4.flagimiz, 0x32 handleâ€™Ä±na bir deÄŸer yazdÄ±ÄŸÄ±mÄ±zda handleâ€™a geliyor.

5.flag 0x16 handleâ€™Ä±nda saklÄ±. BaÅŸtan 20 karakteri flag handleâ€™imiza yolluyoruz.

6.flag iÃ§in 0x34 handleâ€™Ä±na â€œyoâ€ yazÄ±yoruz.

7 biraz tricky. 0x36 handleâ€™Ä±na 0x7 deÄŸerini yazmamÄ±zÄ± istiyor.

8 de 7â€™ye benzer ÅŸekilde

9da 0x3c handleâ€™ini 0x0 dan 0xff e kadar bruteforcelamamÄ±z isteniyor.

256 deneme bitince flagi giriyoruz

0x3e handleâ€™imiz bize 1000 kere beni oku diyor.

1-2 Dakika sonra flagimizi veriyor

Bu sefer farklÄ± bir istek Ã§Ä±kÄ±yor karÅŸÄ±mÄ±za listen for single notification. 0x40 handleâ€™Ä±nda NOTIFY ÅŸeklinde bir property var. Bu property cihaza subscribe olan clientlara notification yollamasÄ± demek. GATTtool aracÄ±nda --listen parametresini write komutumuza eklersek bu iÅŸi yapmÄ±ÅŸ oluyoruz.

12de farklÄ± bir handleâ€™in indicationâ€™Ä±nÄ± dinliyoruz. Indication ve notification nerdeyse aynÄ± ÅŸey demek, Ã§ok farklarÄ± yok.

13 ve 14â€™te multi-indication ve notification iÃ§in dinleme yapÄ±yoruz. Flagimizi ilk notificationda deÄŸilde ikincide veriyor.


15 Bluetooth mac adresimizi deÄŸiÅŸtirmemizi istiyor.

16 BaÄŸlantÄ±mÄ±zdaki MTU deÄŸerimizi deÄŸiÅŸtirmemizi istiyor. Bunu da gatttoolâ€™un interfaceâ€™i iÃ§inde yapÄ±yoruz.

17.flagimiz iÃ§in handle bize write+resp hello diyor. Bunu cli gatttool ile yapamadÄ±m. KÄ±sa bir python scripti ile halloluyor.

  1. Flag ilginÃ§ birÅŸey Ã¶ÄŸretiyor bize. Karakteristik bize propertilerini verirken NOTIFY yok bende dese de, aslÄ±nda NOTIFY yapabiliyormuÅŸ.

0x54 numaralÄ± handleâ€™Ä±mÄ±zda tÃ¼m propertieslerimiz var

Hepsini deneyerek flagimizin parÃ§alarÄ±nÄ± toplayÄ±p birleÅŸtiriyoruz. 0x54 numaralÄ± handleâ€™Ä±mÄ±za herhangi birÅŸey yazdÄ±ÄŸÄ±mÄ±zda handleâ€™a atanan yeni deÄŸeri ilk parÃ§amÄ±z. Notification olarak bize yolladÄ±ÄŸÄ± da ikinci parÃ§amÄ±z oluyor.

Veee son flagimizi de giriyoruz.

Buraya kadar okuyarak geldiyseniz BLEâ€™nin az Ã§ok ne yaptÄ±ÄŸÄ±nÄ± anlamÄ±ÅŸsÄ±nÄ±zdÄ±r diye umuyorum. Serinin sonraki yazÄ±sÄ±nda BLE cihazlara yapÄ±labilcek saldÄ±rÄ±lardan bahsedeceÄŸim, gÃ¶rÃ¼ÅŸmek Ã¼zere.

entry.title: Mobil ZararlÄ± Analizi - BÃ¶lÃ¼m 1: OrtamÄ± KuralÄ±m
entry.content:
Bu seride mobil zararlÄ± analizine yeni baÅŸlayanlar iÃ§in bir rehber oluÅŸturmaya Ã§alÄ±ÅŸacaÄŸÄ±m. Serinin diÄŸer yazÄ±larÄ±nda Ã¶rnek zararlÄ± analizi yapmayÄ± dÃ¼ÅŸÃ¼nmekteyim. Bu yazÄ±mda analiz iÃ§in ortamÄ± kurmayÄ± ve kullanacaÄŸÄ±m toollarÄ± anlatmaya Ã§alÄ±ÅŸtÄ±m. YazÄ±yÄ± 4 bÃ¶lÃ¼me ayÄ±rabiliriz.

  • Ortam
  • Toollar
  • VM Hardening
  • ZararlÄ± bulma

Ortam

Analiz ortamÄ± iÃ§in bir android emulator kullanmamÄ±z gerek. BirÃ§ok alternatif olmakla birlikte ben genymotion kullanÄ±yorum. Performans olarak Android Studioâ€™nun emulatorunden bir tÄ±k daha iyi ve biricik FridamÄ± Ã§ok rahat bir ÅŸekilde Ã§alÄ±ÅŸtÄ±rabilmekte.
Genymotion kurulumu iÃ§in https://www.genymotion.com/fun-zone/ adresine giderek trialâ€™Ä±nÄ±zÄ± baÅŸlatabilirsiniz. Trial bittikten sonra telefona sms yollama, arama yapma gibi birkaÃ§ Ã¶zellikler gidiyor. Ã‡okta mÃ¼him bir deÄŸiÅŸiklik deÄŸil.

YÃ¼kleyip giriÅŸ yaptÄ±ktan sonra ÅŸu gÃ¶rÃ¼ntÃ¼ ile karÅŸÄ±lacaksÄ±nÄ±z.

Add butonuna basarak sanal makine ekleyebilirsiniz. Ben Custom Phone-6.0-API 23-768x1280â€˜Ä± kurdum. Åimdi sÄ±rayla aÅŸaÄŸÄ±daki dosyalarÄ± emulatorÃ¼mÃ¼ze tutup atÄ±yoruz :

  • 1_Genymotion-ARM-Translation_v1.1
  • 2_open_gapps-x86-6.0-pico-20180731
  • 3_SuperSU-v2.46
  • 4_xposed-v89-sdk23-x86
  • 5_XposedInstaller_3.1.5
  • 6_mobi.acpm.inspeckage_v9_4c7fe1

https://vimeo.com/156745941 Åu videoda nasÄ±l yÃ¼klendiÄŸini gÃ¶rebilirsiniz. Videoda dosyalar android 5.0 iÃ§in seÃ§ilmiÅŸ, ancak biz 6.0 yÃ¼kleyeceÄŸimiz iÃ§in benim size verdiÄŸim dosya linkleri farklÄ±. Frida genymotionda 6.0dan Ã¶nce Ã§alÄ±ÅŸmadÄ±ÄŸÄ±ndan Ã¶tÃ¼rÃ¼ 6.0 versiyonunu kullanÄ±yoruz.

Bu iÅŸlemlerden sonra emulatÃ¶rÃ¼mÃ¼z hazÄ±r oldu sayÄ±lÄ±r.

Toollar

Inspeckage

YukarÄ±da yÃ¼klediÄŸimiz inspeckage dinamik analiz iÃ§in kullanÄ±ÅŸlÄ± bir tool. Belirli fonksiyonlarÄ± hooklayarak analiz edilen uygulamanÄ±n hangi fonksiyonlarÄ± Ã§aÄŸÄ±rdÄ±ÄŸÄ±nÄ± otomatik olarak size bildirmekte. Ã–rneÄŸin bir AES encryption yapÄ±yorsa size hangi key ile neyi encrypt ettiÄŸini web arayÃ¼zÃ¼ndeki Crypto sekmesinde size gÃ¶stermekte.

jadx

Jadx yÃ¼kleyeceÄŸimiz apklarÄ± decompile etmede kullanÄ±lan bir tool. Android uygulamalar java ile yazÄ±ldÄ±ÄŸÄ± iÃ§in decompile iÅŸlemi genelde sÄ±kÄ±ntÄ±sÄ±z bir ÅŸekilde yapÄ±labilmekte. jadx-gui sample.apk komutu ile apkyÄ± inceleyebilirsiniz. Bazen jadx decompile iÅŸleminde baÅŸarÄ±sÄ±z oluyor. Ã–rnek

Bu gibi durumlarda apkÄ±mÄ±zÄ±n iÃ§indeki dex dosyasÄ±nÄ± jarâ€™a Ã§evirerek koda ulaÅŸabiliriz. Apklar aslÄ±nda bildiÄŸimiz zip dosyasÄ±dÄ±r. UzantÄ±sÄ±nÄ± zipâ€™e Ã§evirerek iÃ§indeki dosyalarÄ± gÃ¶rebilirsiniz. Zip iÃ§indeki classes.dex bizim decompile etmeye Ã§alÄ±ÅŸtÄ±rdÄ±ÄŸÄ±mÄ±z kodu barÄ±ndÄ±rÄ±r. https://github.com/pxb1988/dex2jar toolâ€™u ile bu dex dosyasÄ±nÄ± jarâ€™a Ã§evirebiliriz.

d2j-dex2jar.sh /path/to/classes.dex komutu ile classes.dex2jar.jar dosyamÄ±zÄ± elde ederiz. Bu dosyayÄ± herhangi bir jar dosyasÄ± okuyan program ile aÃ§abilirisiniz. Hatta bu dosyayÄ± tekrar jadx ile de aÃ§abilirsiniz. Ama bu ÅŸekilde aÃ§tÄ±ÄŸÄ±nÄ±zda apkâ€™nÄ±n iÃ§inde bulunan diÄŸer dosyalarÄ± gÃ¶remezsiniz. AndroidManifest.xml , resource gibi dosyalarÄ±.

Frida

Benim kalbimde ayrÄ± bir yeri olan Dynamic instrumentation toolkit https://frida.re

FridayÄ± Ã§alÄ±ÅŸtÄ±rabilmemiz iÃ§in telefonda bir adet frida serverÄ±mÄ±zÄ±n hali hazÄ±rda Ã§alÄ±ÅŸÄ±yor olmasÄ± gerekiyor. Genymotiondaki sanal makineler x86 tabanlÄ± oldugu iÃ§in https://github.com/frida/frida/releases adresinden en gÃ¼ncel fridaserver-android-x86â€™yÄ± indiriyoruz. adb push fridaserver /data/local/tmp ile emulatore yolluyoruz. adb shell ile emulatorumuzun iÃ§ine giriyoruz. cd /data/local/tmp diyerek dosyayÄ± attÄ±ÄŸÄ±mÄ±z klasore gidiyoruz. chmod verdikten sonra serverÄ±mÄ±zÄ± Ã§alÄ±ÅŸtÄ±rÄ±yoruz

ArdÄ±ndan kendi bilgisayarÄ±mÄ±zda pip install frida-tools frida ile fridayÄ± yÃ¼klÃ¼yoruz. YÃ¼klendikten sonra frida-ps -U diyerek telefonda Ã§alÄ±ÅŸan uygulamalarÄ±n listesini gÃ¶rebilirsiniz.
Ne yapar frida ? Mesela DKHOSâ€™ta Ã§Ã¶zdÃ¼ÄŸÃ¼m bir mobil sorusundan Ã¶rnek https://github.com/eybisi/DKHOS/blob/master/MOBILE400.md . Frida androidâ€™e Ã¶zel bir tool da deÄŸil. IOS, windows, linux her yerde Ã§alÄ±ÅŸan bir tool. Ã–rneÄŸin IOSta Ã§alÄ±ÅŸan bir uygulama iÃ§in, sistemdeki bluetooth fonksiyonlarÄ±nÄ± hooklayarak, uygulamanÄ±n bluetooth protokÃ¶lÃ¼ ile hangi datayÄ± yollayÄ±p aldÄ±ÄŸÄ±nÄ± gÃ¶rebilirsiniz.

Serinin ilerleyen yazÄ±larÄ±nda zararlÄ± analizi kÄ±sÄ±mlarÄ±nda bol bol yer vericem fridaâ€™ya.

Burp

ZararlÄ±larÄ±mÄ±zÄ±n Ã§oÄŸu komuta kontrol sunucularÄ± ile iletiÅŸim kuracaÄŸÄ± iÃ§in bir network proxy Ã§ok iÅŸimize yarayacak. EmulatorÃ¼mÃ¼ze burp kurmak iÃ§in, Ã¶nce wifi ayarlarÄ±na gidiyoruz.

ArdÄ±ndan Modify network e basarak aÅŸaÄŸÄ±daki ekrana bilgileri giriyoruz. Genymotiondaki sanal makineler default olarak 192.168.56.1 ip adresini kullanmakta.

Åimdi burp sertifikamÄ±zÄ± telefona yÃ¼klememiz gerekiyor. http://burp adresine gidip sertifikayÄ± indirirken telefonun browserÄ± Ã§Ã¶ktÃ¼ÄŸÃ¼ iÃ§in bu iÅŸi manuel yapacaÄŸÄ±z. Kendi web browserÄ±nÄ±za proxy ayarÄ± Ã§ekip, burp sertifikanÄ±zÄ± indirin. SertifikanÄ±n uzantÄ±sÄ±nÄ± .cerâ€™e Ã§evirin. adb push /path/to/cert.cer /storage/emulated/0/Downloads komutu ile emulatore sertifikayÄ± yollayÄ±n. ArdÄ±ndan telefonun Settings kÄ±smÄ±ndan sÄ±rayla Security->Install From SD Card diyip sertifikayÄ± yÃ¼klediÄŸiniz klasore gidin.

Kurmak iÃ§in pin ayarlamÄ±nÄ±zÄ± isteyecek.

Ä°ÅŸlemi yaptÄ±ktan sonra burpte proxy ayarlarÄ±na gidip 192.168.56.1 : 8080 i ekleyin

ArtÄ±k emulatordeki HTTP ve WebSocket isteklerini burpten gÃ¶rebilirsiniz.

VM Hardening

Bu kÄ±sÄ±mÄ± emulator ve root detection yapan zararlÄ±lar iÃ§in anlatacaÄŸÄ±m. Ã‡oÄŸu zararlÄ± emulatorde Ã§alÄ±ÅŸÄ±p Ã§alÄ±ÅŸmadÄ±ÄŸÄ±nÄ± anlamak iÃ§in build.props dosyasÄ±ndaki keylere bakar. Bizde bu dosyadaki deÄŸerleri deÄŸiÅŸtirerek bu detectiondan kurtulabiliriz. Bunun iÃ§in Ã¶ncelikle /system klasorunu writeable yapmamÄ±z lazÄ±m. adb shell ile baÄŸlandÄ±ktan sonra sudo su diyoruz. ArdÄ±ndan mount -o remount,rw /system diyerek /system klasorunu rw yapÄ±yoruz. adb pull /system/build.prop diyerek dosyamÄ±zÄ± Ã§ekiyoruz. DeÄŸiÅŸiklikleri yaptÄ±ktan sonra adb push build.prop /system/build.prop ile tekrar dosyamÄ±zÄ± yerine koyuyoruz. Ã–rneÄŸin benim emulatorumdeki prop dosyam build.prop Bunun dÄ±ÅŸÄ±nda sistemdeki binary dosyalarÄ± kontrol eden zararlÄ±lar da olabiliyor. Bunlar iÃ§in en gÃ¼zel yÃ¶ntem frida. Kontrol ettikleri fonksiyonlarÄ± bulmanÄ±z ile scripti yazmanÄ±z 2 dknÄ±zÄ± almaz.

ZararlÄ± bulma

Twitterdaki yabancÄ± abilerimiz Ã¶rnek buldukÃ§a paylaÅŸmakta. @virqdroid https://koodous.com adÄ±nda muhteÅŸem bir site var. Kendiniz rule yazarak siteye yÃ¼klenen apklar iÃ§inde zararlÄ± bulabilirsiniz. YakÄ±n zamanda apklab.io sitesi aÃ§Ä±lacak orasÄ± da efsane olucak gibi.
